questions.title: Two Sum
questions.description:
Given an array of integers `nums` and an integer `target`, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to `target`.

You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.

You can return the answer in any order.
questions.hint1: Use a hash map to store the numbers you've seen so far
questions.hint2: For each number, check if (target - current number) exists in the hash map
questions.constraints:
- 2 <= nums.length <= 10^4
- -10^9 <= nums[i] <= 10^9
- -10^9 <= target <= 10^9
- Only one valid answer exists

questions.title: Reverse String
questions.description:
Write a function that reverses a string. The input string is given as an array of characters `s`.

You must do this by modifying the input array in-place with O(1) extra memory.
questions.hint2: Swap characters from both ends moving towards the center
questions.constraints:
- 1 <= s.length <= 10^5
- s[i] is a printable ascii character

questions.title: Valid Parentheses
questions.description:
Given a string `s` containing just the characters `'('`, `')'`, `'{'`, `'}'`, `'['` and `']'`, determine if the input string is valid.

An input string is valid if:
1. Open brackets must be closed by the same type of brackets.
2. Open brackets must be closed in the correct order.
3. Every close bracket has a corresponding open bracket of the same type.
questions.hint2: Push opening brackets, pop and match with closing brackets
questions.constraints:
- 1 <= s.length <= 10^4
- s consists of parentheses only '()[]{}

questions.title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
questions.description:
You are given the heads of two sorted linked lists `list1` and `list2`.

Merge the two lists into one sorted list. The list should be made by splicing together the nodes of the first two lists.

Return the head of the merged linked list.
questions.hint1: Use a dummy node to simplify edge cases
questions.hint2: Compare nodes from both lists and attach the smaller one
questions.constraints:
- The number of nodes in both lists is in the range [0, 50]
- -100 <= Node.val <= 100
- Both list1 and list2 are sorted in non-decreasing order

questions.title: Maximum Subarray
questions.description: Given an integer array `nums`, find the subarray with the largest sum, and return its sum.
questions.hint2: Keep track of current sum and maximum sum seen so far
